item.title: Primitive Data Types in Assembly
item.description: Each type of variables will allocate a memory space. For example, char requires 1 byte, int requires 4 bytes, and long and double require 8 bytes. And all have different ranges related to that size. It can change by size and generalization for each programming language but it is the same or similar for most programming languages. Let’s analyze variables for C++; Integer Float Double Character Boolean Wide Character Void For example; when you define one of those, compiler generates a size directive and tells how much does it gonna cost to your memory.

How to Setup Assembly in Visual Studio
item.description: If you want to use Assembly on Visual Studio follow the steps below; Create new project (Ctrl+Shift+N) > Empty C++ Project Right click project > Build Dependencies > Build Customizations > Check .masm Right click project > Add > New Item > create main.cpp (name it whatever you want) Right click project > Add > New Item > create test.asm (it must be named something different from cpp) Right click .
